# Role Onboarding Checklist

**Purpose**: This checklist ensures new team members are onboarded efficiently with access to the tools, contacts, and information they need to be productive.

**Instructions**: Copy this template for each new role member. Fill in placeholders (shown in `[brackets]`) and check off items as completed.

---

## New Team Member Information

- **Name**: `[Team Member Name]`
- **Role**: `[Role/Persona - e.g., Business Analyst, Quality Lead]`
- **Start Date**: `[YYYY-MM-DD]`
- **Manager/Lead**: `[Manager Name]`
- **Onboarding Buddy**: `[Buddy Name]`

---

## Week 1: Access and Orientation

### Access Provisioning
- [ ] Email account and calendar access
- [ ] Slack/Teams channel invitations (list key channels):
  - [ ] `[#team-channel]`
  - [ ] `[#project-channel]`
  - [ ] `[#general or #announcements]`
- [ ] GitHub organization and repository access
- [ ] Project management tool access (Jira, Azure Boards, etc.): `[Tool Name]`
- [ ] Documentation repository access (Confluence, Wiki, SharePoint): `[Location]`
- [ ] CI/CD and monitoring tools (as applicable): `[Tool Names]`
- [ ] VPN and security credentials (if applicable)

### Key Contacts
- [ ] Introduction to direct manager
- [ ] Introduction to project manager: `[PM Name]`
- [ ] Introduction to key stakeholders:
  - [ ] `[Stakeholder Name - Role]`
  - [ ] `[Stakeholder Name - Role]`
- [ ] Introduction to cross-functional team members:
  - [ ] Engineering Lead: `[Name]`
  - [ ] Product Manager: `[Name]`
  - [ ] QA Lead: `[Name]`
- [ ] Assigned onboarding buddy for day-to-day questions

### Essential Documentation
- [ ] Review project charter or overview document: `[Link]`
- [ ] Review roles and personas documentation: `[Link to octoacme-roles-and-personas.md]`
- [ ] Read project management process docs: `[Link to docs/README.md]`
- [ ] Review current sprint/iteration plan: `[Link]`
- [ ] Understand Definition of Done and quality standards: `[Link]`
- [ ] Review risk register and communication plan: `[Link]`

### Initial Meetings
- [ ] Attend team standup (recurring)
- [ ] Attend sprint planning or backlog grooming (if mid-sprint)
- [ ] One-on-one with manager to discuss role expectations
- [ ] One-on-one with onboarding buddy for orientation
- [ ] Shadow key meetings relevant to role (list):
  - [ ] `[Meeting Name - Frequency]`

---

## Week 2-3: Role-Specific Responsibilities

### Understanding Deliverables
- [ ] Review examples of role-specific deliverables:
  - [ ] `[Example Deliverable 1 - Link]`
  - [ ] `[Example Deliverable 2 - Link]`
- [ ] Understand handoff criteria for role (see roles and personas doc)
- [ ] Review templates and checklists for role: `[Links]`

### Current Work Context
- [ ] Review active user stories/tasks assigned to role: `[Link to board]`
- [ ] Understand current sprint/iteration goals
- [ ] Identify any blockers or dependencies for current work
- [ ] Review recent retrospective action items: `[Link]`

### Tool Training
- [ ] Complete training on primary tools (if needed):
  - [ ] `[Tool Name - Training Link or Session]`
- [ ] Set up development/test environment (for technical roles)
- [ ] Configure notification preferences and personal workspace

### Early Contributions
- [ ] Pair with team member on first small task: `[Task Link]`
- [ ] Complete first deliverable with review from buddy or lead
- [ ] Provide feedback on onboarding process (helps us improve!)

---

## Week 4: First 30-Day Objectives

### Role-Specific Goals
- [ ] `[Objective 1 - e.g., Complete requirements analysis for Feature X]`
- [ ] `[Objective 2 - e.g., Sign off on release readiness for Sprint Y]`
- [ ] `[Objective 3 - e.g., Lead first change impact assessment]`

### Collaboration Milestones
- [ ] Successfully hand off work to another role with clear criteria met
- [ ] Participate actively in at least one team ceremony (retro, demo, planning)
- [ ] Build relationship with primary touchpoint roles

### Learning and Feedback
- [ ] Complete any required compliance or role-specific training
- [ ] Attend 30-day check-in with manager to discuss progress and questions
- [ ] Identify one process improvement or knowledge gap to address

---

## Onboarding Completion Sign-off

- **Team Member**: `[Name]` - Date: `[YYYY-MM-DD]`
- **Manager/Lead**: `[Name]` - Date: `[YYYY-MM-DD]`
- **Onboarding Feedback**: `[Optional - Link to feedback form or notes]`

---

## Why This Matters

Structured onboarding reduces time-to-productivity and sets clear expectations. A well-onboarded team member:
- Knows where to find information and who to ask for help
- Understands their role boundaries and collaboration touchpoints
- Can contribute meaningfully within the first 30 days
- Feels welcomed and aligned with team culture

Use this checklist to create consistency across onboarding experiences and continuously improve based on feedback.

---

**Related to Issue #5**: This template supports adding new personas (Business Analyst, Quality Lead, Change Manager, Internal Customer, Data Steward) by providing a repeatable onboarding process.
